uk.co.saiman.data

Class PeakShapeImpulseConvolutionFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>

  • java.lang.Object

  • Type Parameters:
    UD - the type of the units of measurement of values in the domain
    UR - the type of the units of measurement of values in the range
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.Expression<ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.SelfExpression<ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Copyable<ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.Expression<? extends ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Self<ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>

    public class PeakShapeImpulseConvolutionFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
extends uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.ImmutableExpression<ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>>
implements ContinuousFunction<UD,UR>
    A function described by a convolution operation over a given set of impulses, or stick intensities, by a given peak shape.

      • PeakShapeImpulseConvolutionFunction

        public PeakShapeImpulseConvolutionFunction(javax.measure.Unit<UD> unitDomain,
                                           javax.measure.Unit<UR> unitRange,
                                           int samples,
                                           double[] values,
                                           double[] intensities,
                                           PeakShapeFunctionFactory peakFunctionFactory)
        Define a new function by way of convolution of the given samples by the given peak shape description.
        Parameters:
        unitDomain - the units of measurement of values in the domain
        unitRange - the units of measurement of values in the range
        samples - the number of contributing samples
        values - the sorted sample positions
        intensities - the intensities corresponding to the given values
        peakFunctionFactory - the peak function by which to convolve

      • resample

        public SampledContinuousFunction<UD,UR> resample(SampledDomain<UD> resolvableSampleDomain)
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        Sometimes it is useful to linearize a continuous function in order to perform complex processing, or for display purposes. This method provides a linear view of any continuous function. Implementations may remove features which are unresolvable at the given resolution.

        Note that the parameter only represents the resolvable domain and the contained samples may not be exactly represented in the domain of the output. For example an implementation may retain some sub-resolution features to indicate maxima and minima within a resolvable interval, such that thin peaks and troughs don't disappear from visual representation at low resolution.

        Specified by:
        resample in interface ContinuousFunction<UD extends javax.measure.Quantity<UD>,UR extends javax.measure.Quantity<UR>>
        Parameters:
        resolvableSampleDomain - a representation of the resolvable sample domain
        Returns:
        a new sampled, linear continuous function roughly equal to the receiver to the requested resolution
